result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanya M Grorich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanya M Grorich

records.addlTxt: 8:53 Defendant Tanya M Grorich in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury trial - 12 person at 07-22-2015 08:15 am

9:32 Attorney Robert A. Gardner in Court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Gardner states that he has had weekly contact with defendant and spoke with her yesterday. He told her yesterday that she did not need to appear today.
Attorney Gardner withdraws his motion to withdraw.
Court excuses defendant's appearance and notes withdrawal of motion.
Jury trial - 12 person at 06-24-2015 09:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 05-22-2015 09:00 am.
must meet with Attorney Gardner weekly.

8:34 a.m  Defendant Tanya M Grorich by phone with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Derek Dominguez  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tanya appears by phone stating her son passed away this week.  Atty. Gardners addresses his motion to withdraw.  He states he will stay on the case if Tanya will meet with him regularly and withdraw his motion.    Tanya addresses Attorney Gardners motion and says she will stay in regular contact.  Court holds the motion to withdraw open.  The bond is modified to require weekly meetings with Attorney Gardner.  Court will revisit the motion on May 22, 2015  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Notice and Motion to Withdraw as Attorney of Record
Cover Letter from Atty. Robert A. Gardner, dated April 29, 2015.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

8:42 Defendant Tanya M Grorich in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner, who appears by phone.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Gardner states his reason why he needed jury trial rescheduled for today. Court grants adjournment. If defendant wishes to plead, she must plead at least 2 days before trial date. Bond is continued.
and Witness List (Plaintiff)
Jury trial - 12 person on February 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.

1:48 Defendant Tanya M Grorich in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves the court to quash the warrant.  Atty Gardner explains Grorich's non appearance.  Moves court to vacate the warrant.  Branch 3 will assign a new trial date.  Matter was set for a plea today but Atty Gardner advises the court that Tanya wishes to stand on her plea.  

Court quashes the warrant and orders Tanya to get a new court date from Branch 3.
Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant. $200 cash.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Exhibit #1

10:09 Defendant Tanya M Grorich in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Michael Topness is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Dominguez. He states on 11/2/14 he performed a traffic stop in the City of Marshfield, Wood County. The defendant was in the passenger seat of the vehicle. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. He observed a green nugget in a purse in the vehicle that appeared to be marijuana. There were many items in the purse with defendant's name on it. The substance tested positive for THC. Defendant denied that the THC belonged to her. Attorney Gardner cross-examines witness. 
Attorney Dominguez asks Court to take judicial notice of prior conviction for for possession of THC, which is marked as exhibit #1.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Defendant stands mute and Court enters plea of not guilty. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on November 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Tanya M Grorich in court, in custody.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
